Maximilian Speicher.
AboutWorkPublications
I'm Max, a traditionally trained computer scientist who does human-computer interaction. I work at the intersection of research, design, & computer science.

Throughout my career, I've designed interactive systems & conducted research on how humans interact with computers—both in academia and industry. My areas of expertise are AR/VR, UX design, and usability.

I minimalism & typography.
Academia.
Currently, I'm a post-doctoral research fellow. The research projects I currently lead at the University of Michigan School of Information focus on natural user interfaces & user experience design, with a particular focus on augmented and virtual reality. In particular, we develop new method for physical and digital prototyping to support the design process of AR/VR experiences.

I earned my Ph.D. from Chemnitz University of Technology in 2016 and my M.Sc. from ETH Zurich in 2012.
Industry.
For two years, I've helped grow HoloBuilder, an AR/VR startup now specializing in solutions for the construction industry. As their VP of Customer & Data Analytics & Optimization, I designed a company-wide data analytics pipeline and was also significantly involved in user research and UX design.

Prior to that, I completed an industrial Ph.D. program in the R&D department of Unister GmbH (Leipzig), where I developed a new methodology for more automatic usability evaluation and optimization of search engines that is still effective.
Other Stuff.
One of my biggest strenghts is that I'm a quick learner, which has helped me a lot in my career so far.

Apart from everything above, I'm also a passionate Ringtennis player. I've won five German Championships and two World Team Championships and was the men's captain of the Germany Ringtennis National Team from 2010 till 2018.
